Format_Notes: Format: UUID or YYYYMMDD-EMPLOYEE-SEQUENTIAL. Example: '20251202-EMP-001-001'.
Identifies which employee this attendance record is for.
Identifies which client/work center this employee was assigned to on this date. Enforces data isolation.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. Example: 2025-12-02.

Suggested_Format: Which shift this employee was scheduled for
Format_Notes: Allowed values: SHIFT_1ST (7am-5pm), SHIFT_2ND (9pm-6am), SAT_OT (7am-3pm), SUN_OT (7am-3pm), OTHER.
Total hours scheduled for this shift
Quality_Level_[YOU_FILL_IN]: Decimal hours. Examples: 9 (standard 1st shift 7am-5pm), 8 (sat OT), 9 (2nd shift). Must match shift_type standard hours unless client has custom shifts.

Format_Notes: Actual hours worked (if employee present)
Quality_Level_[YOU_FILL_IN]: Decimal hours. REQUIRED if employee present. Examples: 9.0 (full shift), 8.5 (left 30 min early), 0 (absent). Null if absent.

Format_Notes: TRUE = absent, FALSE = present. Inverse of actual_hours (if absent, actual_hours should be 0 or null).
Allowed values: UNSCHEDULED_ABSENCE, VACATION, MEDICAL_LEAVE, PERSONAL_DAY, SUSPENDED, OTHER. Used to differentiate types for analysis and billing.
Hours absent (if is_absent = TRUE)
Quality_Level_[YOU_FILL_IN]: Decimal hours. REQUIRED if is_absent = TRUE. Examples: 9.0 (full shift), 4.5 (half day). Used for Absenteeism calculation (KPI #10).

Suggested_Format: Foreign key to EMPLOYEE table (if absence was covered by floating staff)
Format_Notes: Only populated if is_absent = TRUE AND absence was covered. References floating pool employee who provided coverage. Null if absence not covered.
TRUE or FALSE. Default: FALSE until supervisor verifies. Used to flag unconfirmed coverage (data quality check).

Suggested_Format: User ID (supervisor/data collector) who recorded this attendance
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. Audit trail.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). May be end-of-shift or real-time if using time clock.

Suggested_Format: User ID of supervisor who verified attendance (optional)
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. If populated, indicates entry was reviewed and approved.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
Free text up to 500 chars. Examples: 'Doctor's appointment, approved medical leave', 'Called in sick at 7:00am', 'Left early to handle emergency, supervisor approved'.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).

Suggested_Format: System-generated unique ID for coverage assignment
Format_Notes: Format: UUID or YYYYMMDD-COVERAGE-SEQUENTIAL. Example: '20251202-COVERAGE-001'.

Suggested_Format: Foreign key to EMPLOYEE table (employee who was absent)
Format_Notes: Identifies original employee position.

Suggested_Format: Foreign key to EMPLOYEE table (floating pool employee providing coverage)
Format_Notes: Must reference employee with is_floating_pool = TRUE. Prevents double-billing of same floating employee.

Suggested_Format: Foreign key to CLIENT table (where coverage occurred)
Format_Notes: Identifies which client/work center the coverage took place.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. Example: 2025-12-02.
Allowed values: SHIFT_1ST, SHIFT_2ND, SAT_OT, SUN_OT, OTHER.
Hours of coverage provided
Quality_Level_[YOU_FILL_IN]: Decimal hours. Examples: 9.0 (full shift), 4.5 (half shift). Equals absent_employee's absence_hours.

Suggested_Format: User ID (supervisor) who recorded this coverage
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. Audit trail. CRITICAL to prevent same floating employee covering 2+ people in same shift.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
TRUE or FALSE. Default: FALSE. Set to TRUE after supervisor confirms floating employee actually worked this shift.
Free text up to 300 chars. Examples: 'Float-001 covered for vacation coverage', 'Unexpected absence, Float-002 available on short notice'.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
